item.description:
Come Hear It From The Experts

  • Grant sourcing tips and grant writing guidance
  • Expanding your neighborhood network resource base
  • Creative fundraising through neighborhood events and activities

 

Panelists will help inspire you with new ideas to reach financial goals for your Community Garden. Whether you want to raise money to buy new tools, put in a new shed, install rain barrels or new composting bins or shoot for the stars - we will share the wisdom to help you make it happen!


Who:

Bill Stanton, BNAN Coordinator of

Grants and Outreach

Phoebe Flemming, Co-Founder &Director,

South Boston Grows,

Megan Stokes, Director of Development,

Toxics Action Center,

Dave Maden, Executive Director, The Move

PROGRAM IS FREE & OPEN TO THE PUBLIC

RSVP REQUIRED by calling 617-542-7696 or emailing info@bostonnatural.org
item.how_to_find_us: Take the red or orange line to Downtown Crossing and walk southeast to 62 Summer Street and take a left onto Otis Street. You can also take the green line to Park Street or the Blue Line to State Street. Our main entrance is on Otis Street
item.name: Fundraising for Your Community Garden
